channel.title: India Stack Watch
channel.description: Architectural critique of India's digital infrastructure through a cybernetics frame. Evaluating systems by corrigibility, not outcomes.

item.title: Terminology: The Conceptual Spine
item.description: Operational definitions for architectural critique. PRware, Error Asymmetry, Closed Control Loop, Jurisdictional Arbitrage. The vocabulary for analyzing control systems.

item.title: Methods: Evaluation Procedure
item.description: The five structural tests for corrigibility: Safe Refusal, Legible Execution, Independent Verifiability, Constitutive Input, Credible Replacement.

item.title: The Observability Problem
item.description: Open source is not about licenses. It's about whether citizens can observe and correct systems that govern their lives. This is cybernetics.

item.title: Aadhaar: Testing the Claims
item.description: 1.43B enrolled. 210+ breaches. RTI-exempt. 49% biometric failure in Jharkhand. Error asymmetry: fail-safe for state, fail-deadly for users.

item.title: Human Cost: When Systems Kill
item.description: 25 of 42 documented hunger deaths linked to authentication failures. A system that cannot detect its own errors will kill. This is control theory.

item.title: The Surveillance Layer
item.description: NATGRID links 21+ databases. Observation without reciprocity. Asymmetric information = asymmetric power. The panopticon is operational.

item.title: The Layers
item.description: 25+ components. Same failure pattern: closed source, RTI-exempt, no citizen governance. The architecture of enclosure.

item.title: Can You Fork It?
item.description: Credible replacement test. True open source lets you fork. India Stack: governance by black box. Exit means exclusion.

item.title: Can You Audit It?
item.description: Independent verification test. No public audits. RTI-exempt. 210+ breaches documented. Trust without verification is not trust.

item.title: Can You Exit?
item.description: Safe refusal test. No deletion. No opt-out. Participation under exclusion threat is not consent. This is systems design.

item.title: Can You Participate?
item.description: Constitutive input test. Grievance redressal is not governance. Can affected populations shape the rules? No.

item.title: UPI/Payments Stack
item.description: NPCI sees all transactions. PhonePe + Google = 86% duopoly. Financial surveillance with convenience branding.

item.title: Health Stack
item.description: ABDM: 80 crore IDs. Star Health breach: 31M records. Consent theater under enrollment pressure.

item.title: Education Stack
item.description: APAAR: Children tracked from age 6. Lifetime surveillance begins early. No parental opt-out.

item.title: Data Stack
item.description: Account Aggregator, DigiLocker, Digi Yatra. 30% enrolled without consent. Consent as checkbox theater.

item.title: Governance Stack
item.description: Code first, policy later. Private infrastructure becomes public mandate. State-blessed monopoly.

item.title: AI Stack
item.description: Same pattern, higher stakes. Private models, public mandate. Algorithmic decision-making at population scale.
